title: Gregg Botterman
text:
Gregg Botterman (born 1968) is a former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Hooker">hooker</a> for premiership team <a href="Saracens%20F.C.">Saracens</a>, as well as <a href="London%20Welsh%20RFC">London Welsh</a> and <a href="Old%20Albanian%20RFC">Old Albanians</a>. 
He acted as the first choice hooker during Saracens' entry into professionalism and played as Saracens won the <a href="Anglo-Welsh%20Cup">Tetley's bitter cup</a>. As a Saracens youth player he received particular note for playing on against <a href="Orrell%20R.U.F.C.">Orrell R.U.F.C.</a> despite multiple broken ribs.
Botterman finished his professional rugby career in 2004, but remained involved in rugby with a 9 year stint as both player and part-time coach with Old Albanians. This stint would also include a game with the Barbarians against East Midlands, coming on as a replacement during a 48-17 victory.
His niece, <a href="Hannah%20Botterman">Hannah Botterman</a> is a Saracens and England prop, starting for both aged 18 after being introduced to rugby aged 4 by her uncle and aunt (Jane Everett - also an English prop).
